info.title: Nexmo Stitch API
info.description: The Nexmo Stitch API enables you to build conversation features where communication can take place across multiple mediums including IP Messaging, PSTN Voice, SMS and WebRTC Audio and Video. The context of the conversations is maintained though each communication event taking place within a conversation, no matter the medium.

public_key.example:
-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----
MIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCA
KOxjsU4pf/sMFi9N0jqcSLcjxu33G
d/vynKnlw9SENi+UZR44GdjGdmfm1
tL1eA7IBh2HNnkYXnAwYzKJoa4eO3
0kYWekeIZawIwe/g9faFgkev+1xsO
OUNhPx2LhuLmgwWSRS4L5W851Xe3f
UQIDAQAB
-----END PUBLIC KEY-----

capabilities.description: Your application can use multiple products. This contains the configuration for each product. This replaces the application `type` from version 1 of the Application API.

answer_url.description: The URL that Nexmo make a request to when a call is placed/received. Must return an NCCO

fallback_answer_url.description:
If your `answer_url` is offline or returns a HTTP error code, Nexmo will make a request to a
`fallback_answer_url` if it is set. This URL must return an NCCO.

event_url.description: Nexmo will send call events (e.g. `ringing`, `answered`) to this URL

rtc.description: RTC / Client SDK application webhook config

event_url.description: Nexmo will send RTC events to this URL

messages.description: Messages and Dispatch application webhook config

inbound_url.description: Nexmo will forward inbound messages to this URL

status_url.description: Nexmo will send message status updates (e.g. `delivered`, `seen`) to this URL

vbc.description: Specify `vbc` capability to enable zero-rated calls for VBC number programmability service applications. This must be an empty object.

capabilities.description: Your application can use multiple products. This contains the configuration for each product. This replaces the application `type` from version 1 of the Application API.

answer_url.description: The URL that Nexmo make a request to when a call is placed/received. Must return an NCCO

fallback_answer_url.description:
If your `answer_url` is offline or returns a HTTP error code, Nexmo will make a request to a
`fallback_answer_url` if it is set. This URL must return an NCCO

event_url.description: Nexmo will send call events (e.g. `ringing`, `answered`) to this URL

rtc.description: RTC / Client SDK application webhook config

event_url.description: Nexmo will send RTC events to this URL

messages.description: Messages and Dispatch application webhook config

inbound_url.description: Nexmo will forward inbound messages to this URL

status_url.description: Nexmo will send message status updates (e.g. `delivered`, `seen`) to this URL

display_name.description: The display name for the conversation. It does not have to be unique

leg_id.description: The id of the leg. rtc_id and call_id are leg id

member_state.description: The state that the member is in. Possible values are `invited`, `joined`, `left`, or `unknown`

channel.description: When a user joins a conversation as a member, they can have one channel per membership. Channels can be one of `app`, `phone`, `sip`, `websocket`, `vbc`

numbers.description: An object containing number on different channels.

image_url.description: A link to an image for conversations' and users' avatars

href_conversation.description: A link towards a conversation included in Conversation Service API

page_size.description: The amount of records returned in this response

record_index.description: Return `page_size` amount of conversations from this index in the response. That is, if your request returns 300 conversations, set `record_index` to 5 in order to return conversations 50 to 59. The default value is 0. That is, the first `page_size` calls.

event_id.description: Event id. This is a progressive integer

href.description: A link towards a resources included in Conversation Service API

date_start.description: Return the records that occurred after this point in time.
date_start.name: date_start

date_end.description: Return the records that occurred before this point in time.
date_end.name: date_end

page_size.description: Return this amount of records in the response
page_size.name: page_size

record_index.description: Return calls from this index in the response
record_index.name: record_index

order.description: Return the records in ascending or descending order.
order.name: order

context.description: field for internal services to allow meta data injection
